name: sfchronicle
text: After a deadly summer surge during which hundreds of Bay Area residents died from COVID-19, some parts of the Bay Area are finally seeing a slowdown in the spread of the coronavirus. https://t.co/xlXXYsvOTp

name: sfchronicle
text: Cal Fire anticipates the 383,157-acre SCU Complex fires will be fully contained by Thursday. Fire officials on Monday morning reported containment grew overnight, to 60%. More than 20,000 buildings remained threatened by the fire. https://t.co/Qjld08GRcQ https://t.co/esQwjUMjw9

name: sfchronicle
text: The LNU blaze remained at 375,209 acres Monday morning, but containment grew to 63%, up five percent from last night, Cal Fire said in an update. The blaze has destroyed just over 1,200 buildings, while more than 5,000 structures remained threatened. https://t.co/44m5wDwY6K https://t.co/ASZEZ1c0Lx

name: sfchronicle
text: The coronavirus has brought a shrinking economy and renewed xenophobia to San Francisco‚Äôs Chinatown. But there‚Äôs hope for the neighborhood‚Äôs future in how it has weathered these problems in the past. https://t.co/SsUZZEbkxX

name: sfchronicle
text: The CZU fires grew 100 acres, to 84,860 acres, overnight, Cal Fire said Monday morning. Containment is at 39%. More than 860 homes have been destroyed by the fire, which has burned for more than two weeks in San Mateo and Santa Cruz counties. https://t.co/oNWg3Y9UM2 https://t.co/MLjdxsnNDm
